entry.title: Depreciation Keys Mexico
entry.content:
In the Public Cloud, we cannot create our own depreciation keys. For Mexico, the system currently provides:

  • MF05 – Straight-line 5.00% Mexico

  • ML10 – Straight-line 10.00% Mexico

  • ML20 – Straight-line 20.00% Mexico

However, we would also like to have 25%, 30%, and 35%.
Does anyone know a pragmatic solution for this?

entry.title: Re: Mandatory Event Reason for Onboarding Process Initiat...
entry.content:
The "Hireable" status refers to the hireable options which you have configured in the Applicant Status Configuration. The able for the status name can be "Offer" or "Onboarding" based on your system configuration. To answer the main question, the event reason is mandatory to be configured when onboarding is initiated from RCM. I am attaching a few reference links for your reference. 
How to avoid errors when configuring mandatory event reason for Onboarding?
2H 2025 SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding release update: Mandatory Event Reason for Onboarding process
Mandatory Event Reason for Onboarding Process Initiation

entry.title: Should you wait until FPS1 is available before implementing or upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025?
entry.content:
Hello, and thanks for spending some time reading this blog post! As a member of the SAP S/4HANA RIG (Regional Implementation Group), we share our collective insights and knowledge with the broader SAP community through blog posts and SAP Learning courses. We’ve published over 700 blogs and delivered numerous courses to help you navigate the world of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Today, I want to address a commonly asked question we have received since the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025: Should customers wait until FPS1 is available before implementing or upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2025?

Let’s clear the air: Customers who want to take advantage of a new S/4HANA release immediately can and should install FPS00. Remember, SAP S/4HANA was first launched in 2015. Therefore, SAP S/4HANA is a mature solution. Additionally, in the latest releases, SAP has emphasized refinement and enhancements over introducing radical changes, which, in the past, could have been the root cause of errors when implementing the initial stack.

Moreover, our commitment to quality is robust. In addition to rigorous testing by our development team, we actively involve customers and partners in the SAP S/4HANA Beta program with every release. This initiative enables the real-world testing of new features and the evaluation of transition paths, such as new implementations and upgrades. Throughout the program, we received no reports that would jeopardize product stability. In fact, survey results from participants supported the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025 based on their testing experiences.

I'd like to share some good news about SAP Fiori – the primary user experience of SAP S/4HANA - and SAPUI5 - the User Interface (UI) framework of SAP Fiori.  

  • In the past, when SAP released a new version of SAP S/4HANA, the initial release (FPS0) was introduced with a SAPUI5 innovation version, which was not intended to be a long-term version. For this reason, customers often preferred to wait for the SAPUI5 long-term maintenance version, released with a later update (FPS01), before going live with SAP S/4HANA in their production environment.

 

  • Starting with SAP S/4HANA 2025, SAPUI5 is released on the long-term maintenance version right from the initial release (FPS0). This means you can confidently use the user experience in production from day one, minimizing disruptions and ensuring easier support. For more information, refer to the following SAP Notes: 2217489 - Maintenance and Update Strategy for SAP Fiori Front-End Server and 3636986 - SAPUI5 maintenance strategy for SAP_UI and the accompanying SAP blog post SAP Fiori deployment options and SAP Fiori front-end server strategy - UPDATE 2025. 

 

  • As usual, it’s recommended that you start with the latest available patch level of your SAPUI5 version. For SAP S/4HANA 2025, the SAPUI5 version is SAPUI5 1.136.  Your technical team can refer to our new learning video Patching SAP Fiori (SAPUI5) to learn how to apply patches quickly and easily.  You can find the latest available patch level at the SAPUI5 Versions Maintenance Status page.

Of course, there are valid reasons why some customers may want to wait for a future FPS. Here are two scenarios that might justify pausing.

  1. Add-Ons Compatibility: If you rely on Partner add-ons (Solution extensions) or third-party add-ons that are not currently compatible with SAP S/4HANA 2025, it’s crucial to engage with the add-on vendors to understand when they will be compatible. It may take a few months, so it could be wise to wait for FPS1 before proceeding

 

  1. Future Innovations: Each FPS comes packed with new innovations. If there’s a specific feature planned for FPS1 that can add significant value to your business, it might make sense to wait until that functionality is available. To find planned features, you can check the Road Map Explorer.

In conclusion, while there might be reasons to consider waiting, the overall landscape for SAP S/4HANA 2025 is looking promising. If you decide to forge ahead, you can do so with confidence in the maturity and robustness of the solution.

If you are considering moving to SAP S/4HANA 2025 and would like SAP support with product-related issues and product-related questions, you can apply to our SAP S/4HANA Customer Care program, following the instructions described here: Cloud Private Edition - Customer Care.

Thank you for reading, and I encourage everyone to embrace the latest innovations that come with SAP S/4HANA!. If you find this blog useful, please consider giving it a "like" or sharing it. I’d love to hear your thoughts and feedback, so feel free to leave a comment. If you have any questions, just drop them in the Q&A section with the tags SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. We'll try to get back to you as soon as we can.


Thanks,

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA RIG team.

entry.title: Re: ABAP Development Tools for VS Code: Everything You Need to Know
entry.content: Great to see ABAP development moving into VS Code! Focusing first on RAP UI services makes a lot of sense, especially for teams working end-to-end with Fiori and RAP. Excited to see how the tooling evolves and how the community can influence the roadmap over time.

entry.title: Re: Share point access to SAP BODS designer
entry.content:
@siva_dhulupudi wrote:

Hi,

I have a requirement like need to access Excel sheets from different folders in Share point and do the transformation and send it .CSV file/temporary table as target.

Let me know how to access share point to bods designer.

Hello @siva_dhulupudi,
To access Excel files from SharePoint in BODS Designer, use a WebDAV or SharePoint connector to map the folders as network drives or use HTTP links with authentication. Then import the Excel files as sources, apply transformations, and export to CSV or a temp table. Ensure proper permissions and data formats for smooth integration.


Best Regards,
Leah Santos

entry.title: Re: IAS Tenant
entry.content:
Hi 

Both scenarios are supported as described below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/btp-admin-guide/onboard-to-sap-cloud-identity-services

As mentioned by @Wallace some services already have teh scenario with Test->Test and PRD->PRD. Another example is SuccessFactors. The standard sceanario is to have https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/setting-up-sap-successfactors-with-identity-authentication-and-identity-provisioning-services/initiating-upgrade-to-sap-cloud-identity-services-identity-authentication-service

"...we recommend you retain the default settings, which limit the use of Identity Authentication to the appropriate region and corresponding tenant type of the SAP SuccessFactors tenant (for example, ensuring that production Identity Authentication tenants are used for production SAP SuccessFactors tenants, and test/preview Identity Authentication tenants are used for test/preview SAP SuccessFactors tenants)..."

If you are planning for a large landscape and you need to separate user base between prod and non-prod (including posibilities to create test users for non-prod) probably the best option is to use separate tenants.

If you want simpler administration and want to handle prod and non-prod with the same user base makes sense to use one tenant only. This probably aligns with your IDP scenario if you have Entra or simmilar where you most likely have one Productive tenant of Entra and use it for Prod and non-prod apps.

entry.title: Re: Use of CONVERT KEY , which is return as a preliminary key %pid from Late Numbering
entry.content:
Hi, recently, i also to learn about this, outside bdef implementation we need use commit entity begin + convert key to get the final key, in bdef implementation we don't need commit and just need use convert key in save or save_modify，but i noticed that there is such a sentence in the keyword document:https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_cp_index_htm/CLOUD/en-US/abapconvert_key.html
Use this statement in adjust_numbers only if the business objects' saving order in the save sequence is guaranteed. For example, in the implementation of adjust_numbers for BO B, you can specify CONVERT KEY for BO A if B follows A in the save sequence. Ensure A is identified as the predecessor of B, either by declaring a dependent BO or explicitly stating save after in the BDEF.

I'm confused about this. Do you know when it's possible to use the "convert key" in the "adjust_numbers" method to obtain the final primary key? 

Thank you so much!

entry.title: SAP CPI SOAP adapter fails on ~10 MB messages. org.apache.camel.InvalidPayloadException:
entry.content:
Hello Community,


I’m working on an integration scenario where SAP ATTP sends EPCIS messages to SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) using a SOAP Sender adapter (Message Protocol: SAP RM).
The same setup works fine for smaller payloads, but larger ones fail immediately inside the SOAP adapter before any iFlow step executes.

Error Details
org.apache.camel.InvalidPayloadException: No body available of type: java.lang.String but has value: org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload@24ccd933 of type: org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload on: Message. Caused by: Error during type conversion from type: org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload to the required type: java.lang.String with value org.apache.camel.component.cxf.converter.CachedCxfPayload@24ccd933 due to java.lang.IllegalStateException: Current event not START_ELEMENT or END_ELEMENT. 
 
So, CPI rejects payloads around 10 MB, even though documentation mentions the SOAP adapter limit ≈ 40 MB.

Analysis so far:
  • CPI’s SOAP adapter is non-streaming — it loads the whole SOAP envelope into memory before any iFlow step runs.
  • Under certain memory pressure, parsing fails early with this generic CXF exception.
  • Transport-level optimizations like Binary XML and HTTP compression from the sender SAP system are not supported by CPI (it expects plain text XML).
  • MTOM Transport level optimisation works but doesn't help with large message

Environment:

  • SAP Cloud Platform Integration - https://ist-test.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu10-003.hana.ondemand.com/
  • Sender SOAP Adaptor (SAP RM) - Version 1.4
  • Runtime Profile: Cloud Integration

Questions to Community:

  • Has anyone observed similar behavior where CPI SOAP adapter fails on ~10 MB payloads despite the 40 MB documented limit?
  • Is there any configuration, plan sizing, or workaround that allows handling larger SOAP XML payloads (10–20 MB) without switching protocol?
  • Any official clarification from SAP on the effective SOAP adapter size limit would also be very helpful.

 SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: Віртуальна подія | RISE into the Future: Innovation built for what’s next
entry.content:
Відкрито реєстрацію на віртуальний івент “RISE into the Future – Innovation built for what’s next”, який відбудеться 20 листопада.
 
Лише за 40 хвилин ви отримаєте чітке уявлення про те, як AI, дані та сучасні додатки формують нове покоління Cloud ERP Private. Клієнти та експерти SAP поділяться, як ці інновації спрощують роботу, прискорюють ухвалення рішень і допомагають масштабувати найважливіше.

Під час вебінару клієнти та експерти SAP розкажуть про:
  • Загальну картину: де інновації приносять реальні результати.
  • AI та дані в дії: інструменти, які працюють щодня.
  • Легку модернізацію: практичні кроки, щоб залишатися на крок попереду.

Дата: 20 листопада 2025 року
Час: 11:00 EST | 11:00 CET | 10:30 IST
Мова: англійська
 
🚀 Забронюйте своє місце — реєструйтесь уже сьогодні

entry.title: Re: ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of clean core ABAP development
entry.content:
Hi @wagener-mark ,

these are 2 different parameters: 

- for "releasedAPIDataSource" you can either use "checkedSystem" for released APIs in the system or provide the URL if you want to check against the newer version (e.g. your system is S/4HANA 2023 but you want to check with released APIs for the S/4HANA 2025).

- for "classicAPIDataSource" use classic APIs list (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SAP/abap-atc-cr-cv-s4hc/refs/heads/main/src/objectClassifications_SAP.json)

Kind regards,
Olga.

What I’m missing in your case is the ips.application.id property set on the target system. Central store–based provisioning (that is, provisioning from IDDS to any target system) relies on this property being set on the target: Central Store-Based Provisioning | SAP Help Portal

Let me know if it works that way.

Ivelina

entry.title: Assistance Required for Saving Layouts in Review Booklet App
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

I am currently working with the Review Booklet application in SAP S/4HANA and facing difficulty in saving or bookmarking a custom layout. While I do see an option to "Save as Tile" on the SAP Fiori Launchpad, attempting to use this feature results in an error, and the layout is not saved.

In comparison, the Group Data Analysis (GDA) app allows bookmarking and saving layouts seamlessly, which helps in quick access and reuse. I was expecting similar functionality in the Review Booklet app but could not locate any alternative options to save or personalize the layout.

 

Could you kindly guide me on:

  • Whether layout saving/bookmarking is supported in the Review Booklet app
  • If so, what is the correct procedure to save a layout or create a bookmark
  • Any known issues or prerequisites that might be causing the error when using "Save as Tile"

Additional question

Why the error occurs (showing that the problem is with SAP and not us).

Please inform us the correct way to save these layouts, if creating them as templates is the correct way.

 

Your assistance in resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated.

 

thanks in advance!!

entry.title: Re: Do we have "Disassembly BOM" and Production Orders Pr...
entry.content:
Hello @ashisherplogic873 

We do, of course. That would be a BOM with a single component, i.e. a product that is going to be disassembled and multiple co-products, i.e. parts that are salvaged during the disassembly. SAP Help: Co- and By-Products

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: How to switch off message no AA577 enter trading partner
entry.content:
You're encountering the “Enter trading partner” warning because the document type used (A*) has the “Inter-company postings” or “Enter trading partner” indicator enabled. This requires the system to validate that a trading partner is entered in the master data (typically in the company code segment of the asset or vendor/customer master).

What you can do is go to AS02 > Company Code view. Ensure the Trading Partner field is filled under the control data section. Alternatively, if intercompany logic is not needed, you can remove the “Enter trading partner” indicator from the document type in configuration via OBA7.

entry.title: Re: ABAP Proxy generation support with SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hi @AGAS82  -  When the service interface artifact is imported from PI/PO to Cloud Integration , it gets imported with all the dependant objects(Message type ,Datatypes....) . It is possible to edit the Datatype and Message Types artifacts  in Cloud Integration  and the same will be reflected in the SPROXY navigation tree. The Proxies for these artifacts (if already generated) will be shown as Proxy Outdated in case of any changes to them in the Cloud Integration workspace.

Edit and Create of the Service Interface will be after 15Nov2025.

entry.title: Cost Element Category Change in S/4 Hana
entry.content:
Hi All

Is there a way to change cost element category in S/4 Hana? I see that the system allows the change of cost element category currently in S/4 Hana 2020 however SAP suggests following-

a) Either make the change at your own risk. I am not sure why they allow this change if there is any risk. So we won't use this option.

b) Change validity period of cost element. For Example-Change validity end date of cost element to 10/31/2025 & create same cost element from 11/01/2025 to 12/31/9999. However this option is not valid in S/4 Hana so not for us.

c) Delete/reverse transactional data of cost element which won't do as we have lot of data. So this option also not for us.

d) Change cost element category before any new posting in new FY but after closing the existing FY which is practically impossible.

Any other option or work around from anyone? Basically we want to change from cost element category 11 to 01 as G/L with cost element category 11 doesn't work in allocation cycle (Tcode-KSV5). 

Regards

Pankaj

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation reading Excel data from Sharepoint using Microsoft 365 Cloud SDK
entry.content:
I am building an automation in SAP Build Process Automation that should automatically read data from an Excel file stored in SharePoint. I used this tutorial: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-office-integration-agent..html

Previously, I used the “Get Remote File Information” activity, where I could directly provide the file URL to specify the exact Excel file in SharePoint.

Now, I want to modify my process so that it automatically retrieves the most recently added Excel file from the same SharePoint location (instead of using a fixed link), so I tried to replace “Get Remote File Information” with “Get Recent Files”.

However, the “Get Recent Files” activity does not have a field for entering a SharePoint URL or folder path, so I am not sure how to define the correct source location from which the automation should fetch the file. I also don't know how to adjust properly the new parameters, didn't see any tutorials on the Internet regarding this..

entry.title: SAP Business ByDesign Expense reports in new currency for Bulgaria
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

As of 1st of January 2026 Bulgaria will have a new national currency - Euro. We have a Bulgarian company in Business Bydesign and currently are testing the currency transition. It is done via transitioning to a new company code. 

We encountered an issue with expense reports. The employee for whome the expense report is being created was hired in Personnel Administration for Bulgaria with old currency(BGN), so the reimbursement and settlement amount is automatically  exchanged to BGN in spite of his/her working company (where we have set up EUR currency). The currency of a country is a system setting that we cannot change.

Question is will these system settings of currency for Bulgaria be updated by SAP automatically after 01.01.2026? Or else can we do something about it?

entry.title: SAP Service Cloud - Exporting Internal Notes
entry.content:
Dear All,

Is there a way to export Internal Notes within 'Notes' tab in the Service Ticket?

If you have a look in the relationship map, you won't be able to see the delivery note. And the DelNote is always base on the Order. A way could be to look in the DelNote, get back in the Order and then into PKL1 regards Lothar

entry.title: Good receipt and label printing for mixed purchase orders
entry.content:
Dear community,

we often have the issue of purchase orders with mixed item positions: Regular production material mixed with free text orders from purchase requisitions of end users in one purchase order.

 In this case there is no label printing possible for regular production material during goods reciept, only a document for Goods Receipt for PO is printed.

The workaround is to post incoming goods in 2 steps, 1st all freetext order items and 2nd all regular production material. But this means one must look into the entire item list of the purchase order to identify the freetext items, this is somehow cumbersome and laborious.

Is there a smarter way to achieve the printing of goods receipt labels for mixed purchase orders?

Thank you.

BR

Dirk

entry.title: 📢 Let's Make the SAP Task Center Documentation Even Better!
entry.content:
We’re eager to hear your suggestions—take our documentation survey and let us know what enhancements you'd like to see in the SAP Task Center documentation.

Why Should You Participate? 

🔍 Better Docs, Better Experience: Your feedback will help us make our documentation clearer and more helpful.

🎯 Tailored Content: We’ll use your insights to create content that’s more relevant to what you do.

🚀 Easier Workflow: Enhanced documentation means less time searching and more time getting stuff done.

 

Who can participate in this survey? 

This survey is for anyone who uses SAP Task Center, whether you are a daily user or occasional user. Your insights are valuable to us, and we want to hear from everyone.

 

What You’ll Be Asked

  • How easy it is to understand and navigate our docs
  • If the content is comprehensive enough for your needs
  • How well our docs align with your daily tasks
  • Any suggestions you have for making it better
  • Any general feedback on the documentation that you'd like to share

 

How to Participate

The survey is designed to be quick and user-friendly, taking just 5 minutes.

Scan the following QR code to access the documentation survey 

 or  click here to take the survey.

 

Your participation is greatly appreciated. Your feedback will help us create a better product for everyone in the SAP community.

Warm regards,

Your SAP Task Center Documentation Team

entry.content:
AI-Enabled Invoice Assistant

AI-enabled invoice assistant is transforming Cirque du Soleil's invoicing process by driving automation across its multilingual inquiries – reducing response times and boosting global efficiency and supplier satisfaction.
The assistant leverages SAP HANA Cloud to store and process structured data derived from incoming emails, along with analysis results and generated responses. SAP AI Core foundation supports intelligent automation, enabling the assistant to detect urgency, sentiment and even root causes of payment delays. This has drastically reduced manual workload and improved supplier satisfaction.
Products: SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Business AI, SAP HANA Cloud

entry.title: CALM custom check consistencies
entry.content:
Hello dear Experts,

i have requirement to made custom consistency checks in CALM with same mechanism as in SolMan.
I find only some recomendations that i have to use API.
In SolMan it works following way:
1. user is changing status in Task or Feature
2. 1st action execute check for next status. For example, if for the next status some fields have correct data (or any other logic to do in external app). If not - user got message that to go to the next status he need to fill some data.
3. if 2nd all cases for next status correct - status for Task go the next one

And here i have questions:

How and where i can made action which will work for Task in CALM?
Is it possible to return to CALM from external app result that going to next status is possible o not?
Do you have schema with SAP products (i mean do we need here to use Workflow or any)?
Do you have probably some examples or guides how to made trigger when status was changed and how to process it?

entry.title: 存算分离：重新定义云时代的数据处理架构
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

 

想象一下，如果你的家里厨房（计算）和冰箱（存储）必须绑定在一起，每次想要更大的冰箱就必须重新装修整个厨房，或者想要升级厨房设备就必须换掉所有食材——这听起来是不是很荒谬？但这正是传统数据库架构在分析场景面临的现实困境。

Snowflake、Databricks等新兴数据平台的快速崛起，正是因为它们打破了这种"绑定"的桎梏。Snowflake从2020年上市至今，目前市值已经超过900亿美元，而它的核心竞争力正来自于一个看似简单却革命性的理念——存算分离。

 

存算分离技术是什么？

存算分离是一种将数据存储层和计算层完全解耦的现代数据架构设计。

简单来说，它就像是把传统数据库的"大脑"（计算引擎）和"仓库"（存储系统）彻底分开，让它们可以独立扩展、独立优化。

这种架构解决的核心问题是灵活性和成本，为企业带来了按需扩展、成本优化和性能提升的三重价值。

 

存算分离解决什么场景需求？

从ROI角度来看，存算分离在多个维度都显著优于传统架构：

成本投入对比：

  • 硬件成本：传统架构需要预置峰值容量的计算和存储资源，而存算分离可以按需付费；存算分离允许采用成本较低的存储（如对象存储与传统数据库相比）
  • 软件成本：减少了数据库软件需求，降低许可证成本
  • 人工成本：高度自动化的云服务可以大幅减少运维人员的工作量

功能和性能价值：

  • 弹性扩展：计算资源可以在秒级别扩展，而传统架构扩容通常需要数小时甚至数天
  • 并发处理：多个计算集群可以同时访问同一份数据，一方面，企业可以用一份数据副本，同时支撑BI报表、即席查询、数据科学等多种业务场景，另一方面还针对单一场景支持更高并发的查询，
  • 成本控制：闲置时可以完全关闭计算资源，只保留存储成本
  • 增强架构韧性：由于计算和存储可以独立运维与升级，所以某个计算节点发生故障时，调度系统可以快速在其它节点重启任务，而无需关心数据在何处，因为存储层是共享且高可用的。这大大提升了整个数据平台的稳定性和容错能力。

典型应用场景：

  • 数据分析团队需要在特定时间进行大规模数据处理
  • 电商企业在促销期间需要临时扩展数据处理能力
  • 多部门需要同时访问和分析同一份数据资产

为什么会有人想到尝试存算分离？

1. 成本压力的倒逼：

企业发现自己为了应对偶尔的数据处理高峰，需要常年维护昂贵的大型机或集群，就像为了偶尔的聚餐，你必须常年租一个大厨房一样不经济，特别是对于初创公司和中小企业，动辄几十万美元的Oracle或IBM DB2许可费用是巨大负担。但当AWS等云服务商证明了"按需付费"的可行性后，企业开始质疑："为什么数据库不能也按需付费？"

2. 业务场景的变化驱动：

现代企业新需求的波峰波谷明显：电商双11、年末财务分析、临时数据科学项目等，都是短时间大量计算需求
3. 云原生时代的技术自信：

基础设施能力的提升给了用户信心，当网络带宽从1Gbps提升到25Gbps+时，工程师们开始相信"网络就是计算机"，而容器技术的成熟让他们相信可以做到"秒级启动计算集群"，最后，对象存储的可靠性让他们敢于把数据完全托管给云存储

4.竞争压力的推动：

新老玩家的博弈，传统数据库厂商（Oracle、IBM）的技术债务太重，很难彻底重构，这给了新玩家（Snowflake、Databricks）一个"弯道超车"的机会，就像特斯拉不需要考虑燃油车的历史包袱，可以直接设计电动车一样

5. 成功案例的示范效应：

互联网巨头的实践，Google的BigQuery、Amazon的Redshift等产品证明了存算分离的可行，这些成功案例让更多企业相信这不是"实验室技术"，而是可以商用的成熟方案


本质动机：效率革命
归根结底，存算分离的根本动机是追求资源配置效率的最大化。就像工业革命通过专业化分工提高了生产效率一样，存算分离通过技术分工实现了计算资源和存储资源的最优配置。

这不仅仅是技术创新，更是商业模式创新——它让数据处理从"重资产"变成了"轻资产"，从"固定成本"变成了"可变成本"，这种根本性的改变正是推动存算分离快速普及的核心动力。

 

 

过去的技术局限与存算分离的突破

传统技术的困境： 过去的数据库采用"存算一体"架构，如Oracle RAC、传统MPP数据库等。这种架构将计算节点和存储紧密耦合，导致了三个核心痛点：

  • 扩展困难：增加存储必须同时增加计算，增加计算也要考虑存储容量
  • 资源浪费：计算高峰期过后，昂贵的计算资源闲置但仍需付费
  • 维护复杂：数据分布、备份、故障恢复都需要考虑存储和计算的协调

 

为什么过去没有存算分离？

技术条件不成熟是主要原因：

  • 网络带宽不足（过去网络延迟高、带宽小，远程存储访问性能差）
  • 云计算基础设施不完善、缺乏高性能，低成本的分布式存储系统

存算分离的核心价值主张： 让企业像用水用电一样使用数据处理能力——用多少付多少，随时开随时关。

 

存算分离技术原理详解

存算分离的核心原理基于三个技术突破：

1. 高性能网络存储层

利用云存储服务（如AWS S3、Azure Blob）作为统一的数据湖，通过高速网络连接保证数据访问性能。现代云网络带宽可达25Gbps以上，保证及时的为计算引擎提供所需要使用的数据。

2. 无状态计算引擎

计算节点除了缓存不保存任何持久数据，只负责处理逻辑。这使得计算节点可以快速启动、关闭和扩展。就像无服务器函数一样，用的时候启动，不用的时候关闭。

3. 智能缓存与元数据管理

缓存层：在计算节点本地缓存热点数据，减少网络需求

元数据服务：独立的元数据服务管理数据位置、表结构等信息，确保计算引擎能快速定位数据

4. 弹性调度系统

基于云原生的容器化技术，可以在几秒钟内启动新的计算节点，并根据查询复杂度自动分配合适的资源规格。

 

为什么现在能做到？

  • 云计算成熟：AWS、Azure等提供了稳定高性能的基础设施
  • 网络技术进步：高带宽低延迟网络使得远程存储访问成为可能
  • 容器化技术：Docker、Kubernetes等技术让计算资源可以快速启动和销毁
  • 分布式存储发展：对象存储技术的成熟为海量数据提供了可靠的存储基础

这种架构让Snowflake、Databricks等平台能够为用户提供"即开即用"的数据处理体验，真正实现了云时代的数据民主化。

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法

entry.title: HOW TO solve error that access sequence inconsistent, target field missing while performing m/07
Re: What does "APF Buffers Found in Cache" (in sp_sysmon)...
entry.content:
Looking at the SAP Knowledge Base note 2456551 (High threads/engine CPU usage and Spinlock contention - SAP ASE) it says:

"APFs are used mostly for DBCCs and table scans. When there are table scans on tables that are entirely in cache engine utilization can be so high that the ASE appears hung"

and then gives the example:

Data Cache Management
---------------------
  Cache Statistics Summary (All Caches)
  -------------------------------------
    Asynchronous Prefetch Activity
      APF Buffers Found in Cache
                                  per sec      per xact       count  % of total
                             ------------  ------------  ----------  ----------
        With Spinlock Held            0.0           0.0           6       0.0 %
        W/o Spinlock Held           627.3           3.2      376401      96.9 %

this would seem to imply that, when scanning a table in cache, you should expect a high "APF Buffers Found in Cache" count. This in turn implies that "APF Buffers Found in Cache" really means "APF buffer reads not performed because the buffer was already in Cache"

I.e,, a high "APF Buffers Found in Cache" is good because it means the APF disk read was skipped because the data was already in cache.

entry.title: The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: Robotic Integration for EWM
entry.content:
With the request to further increase the level of automation in modern and high-performance warehouses integration of robotics to warehouse management solutions becomes increasingly relevant.

This demand is leading to the question on how to best and most efficiently integrate robotics, fleet management systems and multi-agent orchestration platforms to SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

With this blog post, we would like to discuss some of the most important and relevant questions of the topic of robotic integration to SAP EWM.

What is the right integration technology to integrate robotic systems to SAP EWM?

With SAP EWM there are multiple channels and interfacing options that should be evaluated when integrating robotics and the corresponding fleet management systems.

Typically, robot platforms are integrated via OData APIs, EWM-WCU IDOC interface or via SOAP Webservices and RFCs. Further AGV, AMR and robots can be integrated using MFS over TCP/IP and telegram-based communication. Find further information about available EWM interfaces and specific features and functions via the following links:

  • OData APIs for EWM: Find a list of available ODATA Services for EWM via SAP Help – SAP S/4HANA - APIs for Warehousing or via the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • EWM WCU IDoc Interface: Find a list of available IDocs for EWM via SAP Help – SAP S/4HANA - Interface Between EWM and Non-SAP Systems.
  • SOAP Webservices for EWM: Find a list of available SOAP for EWM via SAP Help – SAP S/4HANA - Enterprise Services in Extended Warehouse Management.

The choice of the integration technology is majorly influenced by the dedicated robotic vendor (integration to sub-systems), partner solution, requirement against end-to-end visibility, type of robotic integrated/primary function (e.g. mobile robot, manipulation robots, cognitive robots, etc.), size and heterogeny of robotic fleet.

Is there a best-practice architecture for robotic integration?

While the robotics integration is highly depending on the aspects mentioned before in the warehouse context the following types of robots are typically used (listed based on primary function):

  • Mobile Robots: Robots moving through the warehouse such as AMR (Autonomous Mobile Robots), AGV (Automated Guided Vehicles)
  • Manipulation Robots: Robots that physical handle and move items such as picking robots, sorting robots and palletizing/depalletizing robots.

In case there are larger and heterogenous robotic fleets integrated to warehouse solutions there are often Fleet Management Systems (FMS) or Multiagent Orchestration Platforms (MOP) from SAP Partners required to orchestrate and dispatch Workload (Warehouse Orders/Tasks) amongst the integrated fleet, performing position management, analytics, routing and training of robots.

Additionally, there are partner solutions on the market that are specialized on industries and process variants such as eCommerce small parts picking, which can be integrated according to a Black Box-integration pattern (EWM viewpoint), as Warehouse Orders/Tasks are optimized and dispatched via the Fleet Management System (FMS) to an integrated robotic solution (e.g. assisted picking robots).

Considering above mentioned aspects, the following integration patterns are most common and best suiting to the requirements of robotic integration:

                Event-Driven Integration

The event-driven integration considers direct distribution of relevant workload via the Warehouse Order Business Event (available with SAP S/4HANA 2025, FPS0) to the SAP Event Mesh on SAP BTP. From the SAP Event Mesh the Fleet Manager System (FMS) can pick-up the relevant Warehouse Order creation, cancelation, activation or deletion events to initiate retrieving relevant Warehouse Orders.

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. Push Warehouse Order Business Event to SAP Event Mesh
  2. FMS to register for the relevant Warehouse Order Business Event from SAP Event Mesh
  3. Perform Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks retrieval from FMS for relevant Warehouse Orders via the Warehousing API (GET)
  4. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit) by the Warehousing API (POST) (optional)
  5. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS by the Warehousing API (POST)

Direct Integration

In basic concept of the direct integration is to either send created Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks to a Fleet Management System (FMS) or retrieve Warehouse Orders/Tasks by the Fleet Management System (FMS).

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. FMS to select open Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks regularly from queue via EWM interface (e.g. ODATA-service, WebService, IDoc).
  2. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by setting updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit)
  3. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS

Additionally, there are project-based integrations possible, to integrate robotics via MFS-telegrams or with small robotic fleets to directly integrate robots to EWM.

What is the typical SAP EWM configuration required for robotic integration?

To enable transparency and optimized integration the following customizing is typically configured in SAP EWM:

  • Queues and Queue determination criteria for robots
  • Resource Types for robots
  • Resource Groups for robots
  • Queue sequence for robot’s Resource Group
  • Resource for robot

Implementation of the following interface functions to connect robots with SAP EWM:

  • Push Warehouse Order Events (create, change, delete, activate) to FMS
  • Retrieve Warehouse Orders
  • Assign Robot to Warehouse Order
  • Confirm Warehouse Orders

We are currently evaluating further enhancements to standard functionality on SAP EWM roadmap to improve integration to robotic fleets to enable for a more robust and dynamic integration.

Are there partner solutions available to integutions to SAP EWM most efficiently?

We have partner solutions offering proven integration concepts and contents available via our SAP Store with the following partners:

Partner

Solution

Locus Robotics, Inc.

Locus Autonomous Mobile Robots for SAP EWM

Geekplus Technology Co., Ltd.

Improve efficiency of your warehouse operation by 2 to 3 times

DXC Technology Services LLC

DXC Smart Warehouse EWM Integration with AGVs

Flexus AG

AGV-Hub - Fleet Manager for Mobile Robots

KINEXON Industries GmbH

Connect and automate operations: redefine manufacturing & logistics efficiency

Roboteon Inc.

Roboteon Fulfillment Platform

Beside these there are implementation accelerators and partner solutions available from our partner ecosystem that are not listed yet in the SAP Store.

What is the future of robotic integration with SAP EWM?

With advancing technology both in logistics, business solutions and robotics, new ways of integration are explored and driven forward. SAP’s initiative to combine advanced robotics with enhanced sensorics and AI capabilities – cognitive robots – and AI-infused logistics solutions leads the way towards new opportunities for automation.

BITZER, NEURA Robotics and SAP went live with a proof-of-concept solution to integrate embodied AI agents to EWM for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition. The proof-of-concept validates Joule-based multi-agent orchestration and execution via the humanoid robot 4NE1 for a picking workflow including visual inspection, enabling agentic situation handling according to the business process and priorities. If you would like to learn more about via SAP News - SAP Expands Physical AI Partnerships and Demonstrates Success of New Robotics Pilots. 

If you would like to learn more about robotic integration, please find more information via SAP Community Blog Enhancing warehouse operations by integrating robotics with SAP Extended Warehouse Management or stay tuned for further release updates and posts.

entry.title: Re: S/4 Hana Cloud Public - Invoice Bloking

Hi @Vijayendra ,

unfortunately there is no possibility to change any field with implementation of BADI FIN_ACDOC_VALIDATION,

with BADI FIN_ACDOC_VALIDATION you can only raise a message and check the data.

Moreover standard app  Manage Substitution and Validation Rules also does not have a possibility to change Payment Block in the FI document.

entry.title: Quantity Confirmation Beyond Tolerance Not Stopping in Order POD
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Requirement:- We have a requirement where, during quantity confirmation from the Order POD, if the user enters a quantity beyond the tolerance limits of the order quantity, the system should block the posting to S/4HANA and display an error message or popup to the end user.

Current Issue:-When users post confirmations from the Order POD, even if the quantity entered is beyond tolerance, the POD displays the confirmation as successful, whereas the IMD shows the message as failed as we enabled the config checks in OPK4  “Error when overdelivery /underdelivery tolerance is exceeded” . This causes confusion for end users, as they are not notified of the failure.

Workaround Attempts: 

  • Tried utilizing all available possible plugins including quantity confirmation plugins, but none were able to stop the posting if it exceeded tolerance limits. 
  • Checked the quantity validation field in Manage Routing, which only works when “Start One Operation at a Time” is enabled.
  • Tested using the Post Production POD, but the behaviour remains the same.

     

    Note:- We are using Order POD for Production orders and all the Collaboration Links are as per help doc.

    Please help us with the possible solutions that can help us achieve the requirement:

    Thank you in advance for your guidance and support.

entry.title: Usage of preliminary cost estimate in period closing for Product Cost Collectors
entry.content:
Dear CO-PC experts,

we are creating preliminary cost estimates for Product Cost Collectors on a daily basis (in order to consider BoM/routing changes for production confirmation).

Our question is, in case of multiple preliminary cost estimates during the month, which one will be used for WIP determination. The current one at the time when WIP will be created (A), the latest one of the current period (B), or at the time the production confirmation happened (C)? Unfortunately I didn´t found such specific information about the topic in the SAP documentation.

Many thanks in advance for a short feedback.

Best regards

Patrik

entry.title: Re: EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync - Flag MainBan...
entry.content:
I managed to set the MainBankIndicator to true using the manageEmployeeIn2 SOAP service. So it works, see code. What I'm missing is how to read this feature. QueryEmployeeBankDetailsIn contains the bank information, but not the MainBankIndicator, and QueryEmployeeIn does not contain any bank information.  Does anyone have any ideas?

 

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"
                  xmlns:n0="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
  <soapenv:Header/>
  <soapenv:Body>
    <n0:EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
      <BasicMessageHeader/>
      <EmployeeData
        actionCode="04"
        paymentInformationListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="false">
        <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>Root</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>
        <ChangeStateID>20251105142859.0000000</ChangeStateID>
        <UUID>xxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxx</UUID>
        <Identification actionCode="06">
         <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>Identity</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>      <BusinessPartnerID>000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000001234</BusinessPartnerID>
   <PartyIdentifierTypeCode>HCM001</PartyIdentifierTypeCode>
   <ValidityPeriod>
    <StartDate>0001-01-01</StartDate>
    <EndDate>9999-12-31</EndDate>
   </ValidityPeriod>
   <EmployeeID>1234</EmployeeID>
  </Identification>
        <PaymentInformation actionCode="04">
          <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>NewBank</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>        
          <PaymentFormCode>05</PaymentFormCode>          
          <BankDetails actionCode="04">
            <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID></ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>         
            <ID>0001</ID>           
            <BankAccountID>1000000000</BankAccountID> 
            <BankAccountTypeCode>03</BankAccountTypeCode>  
            <BankAccountHolderName>Employee Name</BankAccountHolderName>
            <Name>BankName</Name>             
            <BankAccountStandardID>DE32123400000000000000</BankAccountStandardID>          
            <MainBankIndicator>true</MainBankIndicator>
            <ValidityPeriod>
             <StartDate>0001-01-01</StartDate>
             <EndDate>9999-12-31</EndDate>
            </ValidityPeriod>
            <BankRoutingID>12340000</BankRoutingID> 
            <BankRoutingIDTypeCode>BL</BankRoutingIDTypeCode>                   
          </BankDetails>
        </PaymentInformation>
      </EmployeeData>
    </n0:EmployeeDataBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

entry.title: Learning - Assignment profile issue
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have two AP's which are having same curricula, one we are using it for Onboardees and another one is for hiring the same onboardee employee. however we are encountering issue here, During onboarding as an onboardee user completed one training which is added to learning history and another training is uncompleted which is still in Assigned items tab. Later user is hired in the system, now when i look at the assigned items tab , the uncompleted one is gone, it should have stayed as it was uncompleted, but removed it by the system? Why onboarding AP removed it? and Hiring AP assigned the same item again with new assignment date, We dont want this?  why it didnt carrforward the uncompleted one ? is it possible?

Regards

BPG

entry.title: Seeking Best Practices for Integrating SAP SuccessFactors Job Postings with Indeed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are transitioning from existing talent acquisition and recruitment software for SuccessFactors Recruitment/RMK & Onboarding module. We’re currently facing a challenge where job postings created in SAP SuccessFactors are not automatically appearing on Indeed. From what I understand, SF does not support direct scraping of job listings from external job boards like Indeed, and this is impacting our recruitment visibility and efficiency.

We would love to hear from others in the community:

  • Have you successfully integrated SF job postings with Indeed without manual duplication?
  • Are there best practices or alternate approaches to ensure job visibility on Indeed while maintaining data integrity in SF?
  • Any lessons learned or pitfalls to avoid if we take the route of setting up XML feeds or third-party sync tools?

Appreciate any insights, experiences, or recommendations you can share!

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Re: story report : filter error
entry.content:
Hi, I finally raised a support ticket.

The SAP agent asked me to change a setting. So this may be of interest to some of you.

open the story report, in edit mode, open settings,  query settings. Select "Disable Batch Settings".

This may slow down the report a bit, but it will update all data from the server rather than the cache, this is at least what I understood from the explanation.

So good luck.

Kris

entry.title: Posting credit memo: Acquisition value will become negative in dep. area
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We’re currently investigating an issue within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition related to asset accounting. Specifically, when attempting to post a credit memo on an asset, the system returns error messages indicating that the posting would result in a negative acquisition value.

What’s particularly puzzling is that even a minimal amount — for example, just 1 euro — triggers the same error. This behavior seems illogical, especially considering that the depreciation method and related configurations are correctly set up.

 

 

Has anyone encountered a similar situation or found a workaround for this scenario?
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Asset Management  FIN Asset Accounting SAP ERP 

.
